content.description:
The chart below illustrates how many liters of water are needed to produce some common foods.
 Amount of Water (Liters per kilogram) Amount of Water (Liters per kilocalorie) Vegetables 322 1.34 Fruits 962 2.09 Cereals 1644 0.51 Nuts 9063 3.63 Milk 1020 1.82 Eggs 3265 2.29 Chicken meat 4325 3.00 Butter 5553 0.72 Pig meat 5988 2.15 Cow meat 15415 10.19
content.question: Which of the following statements is best supported by the data in the table?

choices.label: Milk requires more water per kilocalorie than nuts do.
Chicken meat requires less water per kilocalorie than cow meat does.
Eggs require less water per kilocalorie than pig meat does.
Butter requires more water per kilocalorie than fruit does.

content.answer: Chicken meat requires less water per kilocalorie than cow meat does.

skill.text: Skill 5.E: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about environmental issues.
